item.title: Pete add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "The mark of the immature man is that he wants to die nobly for a cause, while the mark of the mature man is that he wants to live humbly for one." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Pete add a quote by Khaled Hosseini
item.description: "A boy who won't stand up for himself becomes a man who can't stand up to anything." -- Khaled Hosseini

item.title: Pete add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "He can run faster than Severus Snape confronted with shampoo." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Pete add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Pete add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "When I write, I feel like an armless, legless man with a crayon in his mouth." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Pete add a quote by Fran Lebowitz
item.description: "Think before you speak. Read before you think." -- Fran Lebowitz

item.title: Pete add a quote by Elizabeth Barrett Browning
item.description: "Earth's crammed with heaven... But only he who sees, takes off his shoes." -- Elizabeth Barrett Browning

item.title: Pete add a quote by Chaim Potok
item.description: "I've begun to realize that you can listen to silence and learn from it. It has a quality and a dimension all its own." -- Chaim Potok

item.title: Pete add a quote by Elie Wiesel
item.description: "The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference." -- Elie Wiesel

item.title: Pete add a quote by Richard Hughes
item.description: "Do your bit to save humanity from lapsing back into barbarity by reading all the novels you can." -- Richard Hughes

item.title: Pete add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Pete add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "In the spring, at the end of the day, you should smell like dirt." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Pete add a quote by Joseph Brodsky
item.description: "There are worse crimes than burning books. One of them is not reading them." -- Joseph Brodsky

item.title: Pete add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Pete add a quote by E.L. Doctorow
item.description: "Writing is a socially acceptable form of schizophrenia." -- E.L. Doctorow

item.title: Pete add a quote by Yann Martel
item.description: "To choose doubt as a philosophy of life is akin to choosing immobility as a means of transportation." -- Yann Martel

item.title: Pete add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "Many a book is like a key to unknown chambers within the castle of oneâ€™s own self." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Pete add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Rather than love, than money, than fame, give me truth." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Pete add a quote by Richard Wright
item.description: "I would hurl words into this darkness and wait for an echo, and if an echo sounded, no matter how faintly, I would send other words to tell, to march, to fight, to create a sense of the hunger for life that gnaws in us all." -- Richard Wright

item.title: Pete add a quote by Gabriel GarcÃ­a MÃ¡rquez
item.description: "It is not true that people stop pursuing dreams because they grow old, they grow old because they stop pursuing dreams." -- Gabriel GarcÃ­a MÃ¡rquez

item.title: Pete add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "What really knocks me out is a book that, when you're all done reading it, you wish the author that wrote it was a terrific friend of yours and you could call him up on the phone whenever you felt like it. That doesn't happen much, though." -- J.D. Salinger
